intro: Lepidosperma sanguinolentum, commonly known as the red-flowered sedges, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to Australia and typically grows in wetland or swampy environments. The plant features slender, grass-like leaves and produces striking red or pink flowers that bloom in dense spikes. It is often found in coastal areas and can tolerate brackish water conditions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for water gardens and wetland restoration projects.
